diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with a combination of persistent focal pneumonia, mediastinal and left hilar lymphadenopathy, glomerulonephritis, and respiratory failure after immunosuppressive therapy. His travel history to an area endemic for coccidioidomycosis, along with the constellation of symptoms, especially with eosinophilia and oral ulcerations, led to the diagnosis. Diagnostic testing via bronchoalveolar lavage confirmed the presence of fungal spherules, consistent with coccidioides.
